description.displayText: Keri was our beloved nanny for our kids in a nanny share for more than two years. She is incredible! Keri made deep, lasting connections with both of our kids, from age 0-4. She took them out on outings, designed lovely sensory and arts & crafts activities, and made them feel taken care of and loved. Her philosophy was also always how can she make our lives as parents better -- my home was always neater when Keri left than when she came. We were devastated when our two families outgrew a nanny share, but Keri stayed close to our kids and our family. Any family would be incredibly lucky to have Keri as part of their family.
description.originalText: Keri was our beloved nanny for our kids in a nanny share for more than two years. She is incredible! Keri made deep, lasting connections with both of our kids, from age 0-4. She took them out on outings, designed lovely sensory and arts & crafts activities, and made them feel taken care of and loved. Her philosophy was also always how can she make our lives as parents better -- my home was always neater when Keri left than when she came. We were devastated when our two families outgrew a nanny share, but Keri stayed close to our kids and our family. Any family would be incredibly lucky to have Keri as part of their family.

description.displayText: Keri joined our family when my eldest (now 7) was 1-year-old. She was able to nimbly adjust to 2 iterations of a family share schedule before joining us full-time following the birth of my third child in 2019. She continued to work throughout the Covid pandemic, allowing me to keep my job and meet the kids' needs. During the 6 years she worked with us before moving to GA, she became a trusted friend and beloved part of my children's lives. I knew that she loved them and acted in their best interest. She got to know each of my kids' individual personalities and met them where they were temperamentally and developmentally.  She engaged them in a variety of fun, creative, and interesting activities, developing their motor and language skills. I truly relied on her input about their needs and worked with her to ensure those needs were met. In addition to caring for and loving my 3 happy, energetic, and curious kiddos, she managed to keep the house clean and get the dishes done every day.

description.displayText: Keri joined our family when my eldest (now 7) was one year old.  She was able to nimbly adjust to two iterations of a family share schedule before joining us full-time after I had my third child in 2019.  She stayed with us throughout the COVID pandemic, which is the only way I was able to keep my job.  Keri worked with us for 6 years before moving to Georgia and became a real part of our family during that time. I was confident that she loved my kids and would always act in their best interest. She was able to get to know each one of my children and meet their individual needs and developmental level. She engaged them in a variety of fun, creative, and interesting activities, developing motor and language skills. I came to trust her input and advice when making decisions about the kids and knew that she would go out of her way to make sure they got everything they needed during the day. In addition to caring for them, the house was always clean and the dishes were done when I came home.

description.displayText: Keri took was our nanny for over 5 years, during which she took care of our two children. She was extremely responsible, reliable, caring, and loving. She was also extremely helpful around the house, making lunches and folding clothes. She would take my kids to many activities such as apple picking and ice skating. My kids loved her! We will miss her as our nanny and look forward to having her come and babysit when she's available.
